abstract: Retrieves the results of a search query.
overview:
## Return Value

This method returns a request ID (integer) that you can pass to [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Service/cancel] to stop a pending request.

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Search/search] method returns a set of locations that matches a user-entered query or a [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/SearchAutocompleteResult].

MapKit JS invokes the `callback` function on failure and success with two arguments, `error` and `data`. If you cancel the request before you receive a response, the system doesn’t call this function. The callback can also be a delegate object.

The arguments are:

`The data` properties include:

The following example searches for *coffee shop* in and around the visible map area, and adds the results as annotations:

items.description: An object or callback function the framework calls when performing a search or an autocomplete request.
items.name: SearchDelegate

items.description: An object that contains options to adjust a search.
items.name: SearchOptions

items.description: The result of a search, including the original search query, the bounding region, and a list of places that match the query.
items.name: SearchResponse

title: search(query, callback, options)
